TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EventListener extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class EventListener Implements IDisposable
public ref class EventListener abstract : IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventListener extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 提供用于启用和禁用事件源中事件的方法。

span.span: Provides methods for enabling and disabling events from event sources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件侦听器表示 当前应用程序域中由事件源 (对象) 实现生成的所有事件的目标。An event listener represents the target for all events generated by event source ( object) implementations in the current application domain. 创建新的事件侦听器后，它将以逻辑方式附加到该应用程序域中的所有事件源。When a new event listener is created, it is logically attached to all event sources in that application domain. > [!NOTE] > 此类型实现 接口。This type implements the interface. 使用完类型后，必须直接或间接地释放它。When you have finished using the type, you must dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，请在 `try`/`catch` 块中调用其 方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅 接口主题中的“使用实现 IDisposable 的对象”一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 事件侦听器可以基于每个事件源启用或禁用事件级别 () 和事件关键字 () 进一步限制要发送到侦听器的事件集。An event listener can enable or disable on a per-current event source basis by using event levels () and event keywords () to further restrict the set of events to be sent to the listener. 侦听器还可以使用方法向特定的当前事件源发送任意命令 。The listener can also send arbitrary commands to a specific current event source by using the method. 命令的含义特定于事件源的实现。The meanings of the commands are specific to the implementation of the event source. 如果 用于启用或禁用事件的对象中的属性为 ，则应用程序域中的所有事件源都将受到影响。If the property in the object that is used to enable or disable events is , all event sources in the application domain are affected. 可以在单个应用程序域中定义多个事件侦听器。Multiple event listeners can be defined in a single application domain. 每个侦听器在逻辑上独立于其他侦听器，以便一个侦听器启用或禁用的事件只影响该侦听器。Each listener is logically independent of the other listeners so that events that are enabled or disabled by one listener affect only that listener. 使用方法发送的命令有可能 执行语义操作 (如垃圾回收或刷新影响其他侦听器的数据) ，但这是例外，而不是规则。It is possible for commands sent with the method to do a semantic operation (such as a garbage collection or flushing data) that affects the other listeners, but this is the exception rather than the rule. 每个事件源保留向其发送事件的事件侦听器的列表。Each event source keeps a list of event listeners that it sends events to. 一组筛选条件与每个事件源侦听器对关联。A set of filtering criteria is associated with each event source-listener pair. 这些条件确定侦听器将为当前事件源接收的事件。These criteria determine the events that listener will receive for the current event source. 侦听器会接收其方法的事件 。Listeners receive the events on their method. 因此，的子类 必须重写此方法，以便对数据执行一些有用的操作。Therefore, subclasses of must override this method to do something useful with the data. 创建新的事件源时，将 调用方法。When a new event source is created, the method is called. 每个当前事件侦听器每个 可发送日志消息的当前事件源只获得一个调用。Every current event listener gets exactly one call for every current event source that can send it log messages. 创建事件侦听器时， 会进行一系列调用，通知创建侦听器之前存在的所有事件源的新侦听器。When an event listener is created, a series of calls are made to notify the new listener of all the event sources that existed before the listener was created.

span.span: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建新实例时，将禁用所有事件。All events are disabled when a new instance is created. 使用 方法可启用事件。Use the methods to enable events.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DisableEvents (System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource eventSource);

Public Sub DisableEvents (eventSource As EventSource)

member this.DisableEvents : System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource -> unit

param.name: eventSource
param.span: 要禁用其事件的事件源。

span.span: The event source to disable events for.

summary.span: 禁用指定事件源的所有事件。

span.span: Disables all events for the specified event source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果的 属性 `eventSource` 为，则将 为此事件侦听器禁用应用程序域中所有事件源的事件。If the property for `eventSource` is , events for all event sources in the application domain are disabled for this event listener.

summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例使用的资源。

span.span: Releases the resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用后 `Dispose` ，必须释放对的所有引用， 以便垃圾回收器能够回收占用的内存 。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [清理非托管资源](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged) 和 [实现 Dispose 方法](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose).

summary.span: 启用指定事件源的事件。

span.span: Enables events for the specified event source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 指定的中的属性 `eventSource` 为 ，则应用程序域中的所有事件源都将受到影响。If the property in the specified `eventSource` is , all event sources in the application domain are affected.

summary.span: 当事件源（ 对象）附加到调度程序时发生。

span.span: Occurs when an event source ( object) is attached to the dispatcher.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 创建事件侦听器时，以及在创建事件侦听器之后创建的任何事件源，都将发生此事件。The occurs for all existing event sources when the event listener is created, as well as for any event sources that are created after the event listener's creation.

param.name: eventSource
param.span: 要查找其索引的事件源。

span.span: The event source to find the index for.

summary.span: 获取表示指定事件源的较小非负数。

span.span: Gets a small non-negative number that represents the specified event source.

returns.span: 表示指定的事件源的较小非负数。

span.span: A small non-negative number that represents the specified event source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回的值 标识适用于对数组进行索引的事件源。The value returned by identifies an event source that is suitable for indexing an array. 此整数在应用程序域中是唯一的。This integer is unique within the application domain. 事件侦听器可能会发现，存储有关连接到它的每个事件源的其他信息是很有用的。An event listener might find it useful to store additional information about each event source that is connected to it. 返回的值 允许将这些额外的信息有效地存储在可扩充的数组中，例如 `List` 。The value returned by allows this extra information to be efficiently stored in a expandable array such as `List`.

span.span: Occurs when an event has been written by an event source ( object) for which the event listener has enabled events.

span.span: The event source.

summary.span: 当创建该事件侦听器且将新事件源附加到侦听器时，对所有现有事件源执行了调用。

span.span: Called for all existing event sources when the event listener is created and when a new event source is attached to the listener.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件源实现应注意，在实例化事件侦听器时，会为现有事件源颁发这些回调。Event source implementations should be aware that these callbacks are issued for existing event sources when the event listener is instantiated. 在多线程环境中，可以在 回调之前进行回调 。In a multithreaded environment, it is possible for callbacks to occur before the callback.

summary.span: 每次事件源写入事件时都执行调用，其中事件侦听器为事件源启用了事件。

span.span: Called whenever an event has been written by an event source for which the event listener has enabled events.
